title: SQL Injection Vulnerability
description: SQL Injection occurs when untrusted input is included directly in SQL queries.
risk: Can lead to data leakage, data modification, or full database compromise.
code_pattern: SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = ''' + email + '''
explanation: The query is constructed using string concatenation, allowing attackers to inject malicious SQL payloads.
fix: Use prepared statements or ORM query builders.

title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
description: XSS occurs when untrusted data is rendered directly into the DOM without sanitization.
risk: Allows attackers to execute malicious scripts in users' browsers.
explanation: Directly injecting user input into HTML enables script execution.
fix: Sanitize user input and avoid using innerHTML.

title: Hardcoded Secrets in Source Code
description: Secrets such as API keys or passwords are directly embedded in source code.
risk: Leaked credentials can be abused if the repository becomes public.
explanation: Secrets in code are easily exposed through version control.
fix: Store secrets in environment variables or secret managers.
